alert.note: Alert for Garfield; San Juan (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued October 02 at 7:12PM MDT until October 02 at 8:45PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR SAN JUAN AND NORTHEASTERN GARFIELD COUNTIES... At 712 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.5 and 1.0 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... mainly rural areas of San Juan and Northeastern Garfield Counties This includes the following highways... Utah Route 276 between mile markers 0 and 17. Utah Route 95 between mile markers 22 and 42. This includes the following streams and drainages... Trachyte Creek, Bulldog Creek, Dirty Devil River, Quaking Aspen Creek, South Fork Swett Creek, Straight Creek, Poison Spring, Pennell Creek, Shitamaring Creek, Benson Creek, Speck Creek, Crescent Creek, Hansen Creek, Browns Creek, Copper Creek and Colorado River. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Dry washes, streams, and rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
